articles.headline: Argentina to Seize Control of Oil Company
articles.snippet: The expropriation would reassert state control over a pillar of Argentina’s economy but also increase diplomatic tensions with Spain and the European Union.
articles.abstract: The expropriation would reassert state control over a pillar of Argentina’s economy but also increase diplomatic tensions with Spain and the European Union.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Argentina’s president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, announced on Monday that the government would seize a majority stake in YPF, the nation’s largest oil company.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Raphael Minder

articles.headline: For Two Economists, the Buffett Rule Is Just a Start
articles.snippet: Research by Emmanuel Saez and Thomas Piketty, two French economists known simply as Piketty-Saez in Washington, has provided the subtext to the battle over tax fairness.
articles.abstract: Research by Emmanuel Saez and Thomas Piketty, two French economists known simply as Piketty-Saez in Washington, has provided the subtext to the battle over tax fairness.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — High earners who are worried that this year’s Tax Day will be the last one before their rates rise have more than just the White House and Washington to blame. They can also look to two academically revered, if publicly obscure, left-leaning French economists whose work is the subtext for the battle over tax fairness.

articles.headline: Central Bank Not Expected to Try to Ease Europe’s Crisis
articles.snippet: Some political leaders, particularly in France, are feeling public heat because of unpopular government policies in response to Europe’s debt debacle.
articles.abstract: Some political leaders, particularly in France, are feeling public heat because of unpopular government policies in response to Europe’s debt debacle.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — As the euro zone crisis shows signs of heating up again, political leaders are once more looking to the European Central Bank for help.
articles.byline: By Jack Ewing and Raphael Minder

articles.headline: Son’s Parties and Privilege Aggravate Fall of Elite Chinese Family
articles.snippet: Communist party officials are angered by the lifestyle of Bo Guagua, whose parents, Bo Xilai and Gu Kailai, are subjects of corruption and murder investigations.
articles.abstract: Communist party officials are angered by the lifestyle of Bo Guagua, whose parents, Bo Xilai and Gu Kailai, are subjects of corruption and murder investigations.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — As the grandson of revolutionary giants, Bo Guagua enjoyed the prestige and privilege that accompanies membership in China’s “red aristocracy.”
articles.byline: By Andrew Jacobs and Dan Levin

articles.headline: Afghan Assaults Signal Evolution of a Militant Foe
articles.snippet: The Haqqani offshoot of the Taliban displayed discipline and sophistication in the latest attacks, which has Western officials concerned at their failure to intercept any intelligence chatter.
articles.abstract: The Haqqani offshoot of the Taliban displayed discipline and sophistication in the latest attacks, which has Western officials concerned at their failure to intercept any intelligence chatter.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Western military and intelligence officials acknowledged on Monday that they were surprised by the scale and sophistication of the synchronized attacks in Afghanistan on Sunday, seeing it as a troubling step in the evolution of the Haqqani Taliban network from a crime mob to a leading militant force.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Alissa J. Rubin

articles.headline: An Online TV Site Grows Up
articles.snippet: Hulu will promote its original programming to advertisers this week in an annual ritual known as upfronts that is typically reserved for cable channels and network broadcasters.
articles.abstract: Hulu will promote its original programming to advertisers this week in an annual ritual known as upfronts that is typically reserved for cable channels and network broadcasters.
articles.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, some of the most powerful players in television banded together to introduce Hulu, a streaming service intended to revolutionize the TV industry.
articles.byline: By Amy Chozick and Brian Stelter

articles.headline: Once Every 36 Years, Primary Fight for Indiana Senator
articles.snippet: At age 80, Richard G. Lugar, one of the longest-serving members of the United States Senate, is getting a crash course in what a campaign looks like.
articles.abstract: At age 80, Richard G. Lugar, one of the longest-serving members of the United States Senate, is getting a crash course in what a campaign looks like.
articles.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — At age 80, Richard G. Lugar, one of the longest-serving members of the United States Senate, is getting a crash course in what a campaign looks like.
